title.narrative: Emergency Winter Shelter/NFI for Anbar and Tal Afar

description.narrative:
Since the liberation of formerly ISIS held areas of western Iraq there has been a shift in IDP movements back to their home villages, however, these areas have not been reached by humanitarian assistance in terms of shelter and NFI’s aimed at winterization. Thus the returnees are facing a hazardous situation as they return ill prepared for winter conditions and to houses which are likely to have suffered damage and destruction during the conflict. The uncertain living conditions has led to families living in improvised shelters, community buildings or sharing relatives houses in overcrowded conditions. A shelter and NFI winterization response in this context can provide shelter, safety and dignity to the beneficiaries, which will also have positive impacts on health and mental wellbeing. Rapid Needs Assessments conducted in November and December 2017 by Oxfam and Human Appeal indicate a strong need for winterization materials and shelter support. In addition we have been in contact with Medair, Mission East, TDH, ICRC and Oxfam to discuss the activities they are undertaking in the region. As a result we will be visiting some of the villages where Oxfam have donated NFI to ensure that Sealing off kits are also provided.
This project will provide shelter and winter NFI packages to vulnerable households aimed at providing them with the necessary items to be prepared for the winter conditions. The items include blankets and kerosene heaters and fuel for warmth and plywood, hinges and construction tools to repair and maintain damaged houses to make them secure and safe. The package includes a Mobile Emergency Shelter Kit (MESK) which comprises of a tarpaulin, pegs, rope and other items to construct an emergency mobile shelter. These were donated by UN Habitat. As a result this donation a decision was made to utilize the remaining funds and provide heaters, blankets and jerry cans to each of the families.
The contents of the package are designed to meet the needs of the beneficiaries as identified in primary and secondary sources and to align with the Shelter Cluster Strategic Response Plan which prioritises durable solutions for shelter and NFI in areas of return. The plan targets returnees, highly vulnerable populations not adequately covered by social protection and non-displaced people in newly accessible areas which concurs with the target beneficiaries of this project. This project aims to reach a total of 4000 households (24,000 people, 12,000 female, 12000 male) through distributions of essential shelter and winter NFI packages.
